poem:
**The Offer Unseen**

Upon the paper's crisp fold,  
a girl's dream flutters,  
half-formed whispers of  
a Stanford sun.  
  
Doubt pools like shadow  
by lettered light—  
come clear, truth,  
or remain a whispered leaf  
in morning's forgetting.  
  
Yet still, youth's heart  
clutches secret,  
untouched by the reckon  
of light or letter.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Badenoch urged to ‘come clean’ after doubt cast on Stanford University claim Labour and the Liberal Democrats have called for Kemi Badenoch to come clean about her claims of an offer from Stanford University at the age of 16, after former admissions staff said she had described an impossible scenario. The Labour MP Peter Prinsley has written to the Conservatives leader saying she should lay out the specifics of how the alleged offer came about,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Badenoch urged to ‘come clean’ after doubt cast on Stanford University claim Labour and the Liberal Democrats have called for Kemi Badenoch to come clean about her claims of an offer from Stanford University at the age of 16, after former admissions staff said she had described an impossible scenario. The Labour MP Peter Prinsley has written to the Conservatives leader saying she should lay out the specifics of how the alleged offer came about,
